intro: Mapouria douarrei, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
